original: ` do dum bur byed pa la dpri sogs kyi ya /
analyzed: ` do dum bur byed pa la dpri sogs kyi ya /

original: ao phyis pas /
analyzed: ao phyis pas /

analyzed: dya ti sogs dang / ` de bzhin du / sho phra mor byed pa la /

original: shya ti sogs dang ; ` sho mtha'i las la /
analyzed: shya ti sogs dang ; ` sho mtha'i las la /
translated: _Śya is for the end of śo,

original: sya ti sogs so /🔽` / po ru ra: pu'i ri aura\'o //
analyzed: sya ti sogs so / ` / po ru ra: pu'i ri aura\'o //

original: pu ste byings pa sde'i yi ge sngon na yod pa'i ri yig ni kang 'gro ba'i ming can pha rol la aura\ du 'gyur te /
analyzed: pu ste byings pa sde'i yi ge sngon na yod pa'i ri yig ni kang 'gro ba'i ming can pha rol la aura\ du 'gyur te /
translated: _Pu is for the root, and the ri that is in front of a nominal base letter becomes ur in the sense of going to the other side.

original: ` mring srog 'dor ba la //
analyzed: ` mring srog 'dor ba la //
translated: _Mriṅ is for taking away life.

original: 'dod pa'i don gyis ri aura\ gnyis brjod pa sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don gyis ri aura\ gnyis brjod pa sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /
translated: _By repeating the desired meaning, etc., it is accomplished.

original: mu m'ursha ti sogs so //
analyzed: mu m'ursha ti sogs so //

original: mring la sa rkyen dang lkog gyur gyi don la pa rasmee pa da rnams 'jug par bshad pa las /
analyzed: mring la sa rkyen dang lkog gyur gyi don la pa rasmee pa da rnams 'jug par bshad pa las /

original: sa rkyen bstan zin la /
analyzed: sa rkyen bstan zin la /
translated: _The condition of sa has been explained.

original: lkog gyur la /🔽ma m'a ra sogs dang / de gnyis las gzhan du a'atma ne pa da rnams 'jug pas /
analyzed: lkog gyur la / ma m'a ra sogs dang / de gnyis las gzhan du a'atma ne pa da rnams 'jug pas /

original: mri ya te sogs so /
analyzed: mri ya te sogs so /
translated: _Therefore, mriyate, etc.

original: ` / ru d'a de tsa turn'am hva s'a de: rud sogs las bzhi po rnams kyi ha dang ba sa la'o //🔽byings rud la sogs pa las pha rol gyi rnam dbye byings thams cad pa'i ming can bzhi po rnams kyi rkyen dang rnam dbye ha yig dang ba sa'i yi ge dang po la aita\ a'a ga ma ster bar bya ste /
analyzed: ` / ru d'a de tsa turn'am hva s'a de: rud sogs las bzhi po rnams kyi ha dang ba sa la'o // byings rud la sogs pa las pha rol gyi rnam dbye byings thams cad pa'i ming can bzhi po rnams kyi rkyen dang rnam dbye ha yig dang ba sa'i yi ge dang po la aita\ a'a ga ma ster bar bya ste /
translated: The four, Rud, etc., have ha and va as their first syllables.🔽The four, Rud, etc., have ha and va as their first syllables, and they are all names of the class of all the case endings of the remote.🔽The iṭ affix is given to the first syllable of the ha and va classes,

original: ` ru dir\ dra mchi ma 'dzag pa la aanga\ sogs kyi aapa\ 'jig / ha dang ba sa'i yi ge dang po can la ait\ ster ba sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /🔽@110a * // ro de ti /

analyzed: dzaksha / dz'a gri /

analyzed: da ri dr'a /

analyzed: ` da ri dr'a ngan 'gro la'o zhes pa la / da ri dr'a ti /

original: da ri dri ti /
analyzed: da ri dri ti /

analyzed: da ri dra ti sogs so /

analyzed: ` / sh'as rjes su 'thor ba la /

analyzed: sh'asti / shishta: sh'a sa ti sogs dang / ` a'i d'i sho: a'ida\ a'isha\ dag las so //

analyzed: byings a'ida\ dang a'isha\ dag las pha rol gyi rnam dbye sa yig dang dhve dag la aita\ a'a ga ma ster bar bya ste /

analyzed: ` a'ida\ bstod pa la / a'itte / a'i d'a te /

analyzed: a'i da te / a'i di she /

original: a'i d'a the /
analyzed: a'i d'a the /

original: a'i di dhve /
analyzed: a'i di dhve /

original: a'i de / a'idva he /
analyzed: a'i de / a'idva he /

original: a'i dma he sogs dang / ` de bzhin du /
analyzed: a'i dma he sogs dang / ` de bzhin du /

analyzed: a'i sha te / a'i shi she / a'i sh'a the /

analyzed: a'i shi dhve sogs so /

original: ` / ao roo /
analyzed: ` / ao roo /

original: au'i aoo'o // yu sogs byings mang po @110b zhig gi mtha'i au ni rnam dbye pa 'gro ba'i ming can ta yig dang sa yig dang ma yig dang po can pha rol las aoo ru 'gyur ro /
analyzed: au'i aoo'o // yu sogs byings mang po @110b zhig gi mtha'i au ni rnam dbye pa 'gro ba'i ming can ta yig dang sa yig dang ma yig dang po can pha rol las aoo ru 'gyur ro /
translated: The u at the end of many roots such as yu becomes o when the suffix ta, sa, ma, or pa is added.

original: ` yu nu ru stu bhya a'irb'a /
analyzed: ` yu nu ru stu bhya a'irb'a /
translated: yu, nu, ru, stu, bhya, ṛbhu.

original: yu nu ru stu rnams las a'ira\ yang na'o //
analyzed: yu nu ru stu rnams las a'ira\ yang na'o //
translated: From yu, nu, ru, and stu, ṛ is also possible.

original: byings yul la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi au ni rkyen bshad ma thag pa'i tshad nyid de rnams tshang ba pha rol la aoo ru bsgyur ba dang yang na ao ru 'gyur zhing ao ru bsgyur ba'i phyogs la a'ira\ a'a ga ma ster bar bya ste /
analyzed: byings yul la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi au ni rkyen bshad ma thag pa'i tshad nyid de rnams tshang ba pha rol la aoo ru bsgyur ba dang yang na ao ru 'gyur zhing ao ru bsgyur ba'i phyogs la a'ira\ a'a ga ma ster bar bya ste /
translated: The u of these roots such as yu is the same measure as the just explained suffix. When all of those are complete, it becomes o on the other side. Or it becomes o and on the side of being changed to o, ṛ is given to the following.

original: ra\ rjes 'brel /
analyzed: ra\ rjes 'brel /

original: aoo dang ao 'dam ka can du byas pas /
analyzed: aoo dang ao 'dam ka can du byas pas /

analyzed: ` yu spel ba la / yoo ti sogs sam /

analyzed: ya b'i ti sogs so / ` / de bzhin du nu ded pa la / noo ti sogs sam /

analyzed: na b'i ti sogs so /

original: ` / ru sgra la /🔽roo ti sogs sam /
analyzed: ` / ru sgra la / roo ti sogs sam /

original: ra b'i ti sogs so /
analyzed: ra b'i ti sogs so /

original: ` /shtunya\ bstod pa la /🔽stoo ti sogs sam /
analyzed: ` /shtunya\ bstod pa la / stoo ti sogs sam /

original: sta b'i ti sogs so //
analyzed: sta b'i ti sogs so //

original: nga 'gro ba rnams la bya ba lhag po med pas /
analyzed: nga 'gro ba rnams la bya ba lhag po med pas /

analyzed: yu ta: yu banti sogs so / ` / lo pa sta nu d'atta ta nam / tana\ rnams kyi aa nu d'atta dbyi ba nyid do //
translated: yu, ti, yu, van, ti, etc. are used.🔽 The augment of ta, nu, da, ta, and na is the elision of the final a.

original: byings ta nu la sogs pa rnams kyi mtha'i aa nu d'atta ste nya ma so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge rnams ni kra nga\ 'gro ba'i ming can dzha sa'i yi ge dang po pha rol la dbyi bar bya ba nyid de /

original: ` hana\ 'tshe ba la /
analyzed: ` hana\ 'tshe ba la /

original: hanti / ha ta:ghna ti sogs so /
analyzed: hanti / ha ta:ghna ti sogs so /
translated: han, ti, ha, ta, ghan, ti, etc. are used.🔽 In the root nam, to bow,

analyzed: ` / na ma: nama\ la'o //
translated: na, ma, la, etc. are used.

analyzed: nama\ bi k'a ra na pha rol la'ang byings kyi nya ma'i yi ge rnams dbyi bar bya ste /
translated: In the case of the other, the vowels of the root are also elided.🔽`

original: ` hingsa 'tshe ba la /
analyzed: ` hingsa 'tshe ba la /

analyzed: rundha sogs kyi nam\ sbyar nga\ dbyi ba sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /

original: hanasti / him stam:hidsanti sogs so /
analyzed: hanasti / him stam:hidsanti sogs so /
translated: Thus, hiṃsati, hiṃsati, hiṃsantī, and so on.🔽`

original: ` / bhadza\ bsnyen pa la /
analyzed: ` / bhadza\ bsnyen pa la /
translated: In the case of the root bhaj, to worship,

original: nama\ bi k'a ra na sbyar bas /
analyzed: nama\ bi k'a ra na sbyar bas /

analyzed: bha nakti / bhamkta:bham dzanti sogs so / ` / aa pi ranydza dam sha sham dza shvam dz'am /
translated: The affixes of the present tense are ap, ar, and am.🔽The affixes of the past tense are a, ā, and aṃ.

analyzed: aapa\ la ranydza dam sha\ shanydza shvanydza rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: aapa\ bi k'a ra na pha rol la byings ranydza la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi au pa dh'a'i na\ yig ni dbyi bar bya ste / ranydza la / ra dza ti / ra dza ta:ra dzanti sogs dang / ` de bzhin du /
translated: The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.🔽The affixes of the continuative are ta, ta, and taṃ.

original: da sha ti /🔽sa dza ti /🔽sva dza ti sogs so /

original: saha\ baha\ dag gi aa yig ni aota\'o //
analyzed: saha\ baha\ dag gi aa yig ni aota\'o //
translated: The root is sa, the suffix is -ha, and the affix is -varo-d-a.🔽The a of sa and bha becomes o.

original: byings saha\ dang baha\ dag gi aa yig ni rkyen tri pha rol la ao ru 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings saha\ dang baha\ dag gi aa yig ni rkyen tri pha rol la ao ru 'gyur te /

analyzed: saha\ dang baha\ la tri / ha'i dha\/ ta tha dag gi dha /

analyzed: yu bu dag gi aa na aa ka dag go / rkyen yu dang bu dag ni rim pa ltar aa na dang aa ga zhes par bsgyur bar bya ste /

analyzed: pa tsa\ la bu nya\ nya\ 'gro ba la 'phel ba /

original: bu aa kar\ bsgyur pas /
analyzed: bu aa kar\ bsgyur pas /

analyzed: p'a tsa ka zhes 'grub pa la rnam dbye rnams sbyar bas /

translated: The meaning of asahayo sahayo babhūva is the non-companion became a companion.🔽 The meaning of ahetuḥ hetum akārṣīt is the non-cause became a cause.🔽 The meaning of ahetuḥ hetum akārṣīt is the non-cause became a cause.

original: (lhan cig ma yin pa lhan cig par gyur to//) ....sa h'a y'i tsvi sy'ata\ sogs dang / aa he tu: he tu: kri tam ....(rgyu med pa la rgyu byas so//) zhes pa'i don las he (tsvi) t'u kri tam ....(rgyu med pa la rgyu byas so//) sogs so /🔽` / tsvoo sa lo pashtsa /

translated: The word ca is added.

original: tsvi la sa dbyi ba'ang ngo //
analyzed: tsvi la sa dbyi ba'ang ngo //
translated: The word ca is also deleted.

original: gsar byung gi rkyen tsvi pha rol la sngon ma'i mtha' sa yig yin na dbyi bar bya ste /
analyzed: gsar byung gi rkyen tsvi pha rol la sngon ma'i mtha' sa yig yin na dbyi bar bya ste /
translated: If the new condition ca has the previous ending sa, it should be deleted.

original: auta\ sngon ma'i ma na sa\ la tsvi sa\ phyis aa a'i ru bsgyur bas /
analyzed: auta\ sngon ma'i ma na sa\ la tsvi sa\ phyis aa a'i ru bsgyur bas /

original: aunma n'i bh'a ba:....(skyo bar gyur to//) yang skabs la lang tsvi'i don la rkyen d'a ster bar bshad de /
analyzed: aunma n'i bh'a ba:....(skyo bar gyur to//) yang skabs la lang tsvi'i don la rkyen d'a ster bar bshad de /
translated: Again, in some cases, the meaning of the root is explained by the suffix.🔽Duḥkhaṃ karoti,🔽“He causes suffering.”🔽Bhadraṃ karoti,🔽“He causes good.”

original: du: kh'a ...(d'a) ka ro ti/....(sdug bsngal bar byed/) bha (d'a) dr'a ka ro ti ....(bzang por byed/) sogs so /🔽` / a'a te ma ni pa\ kva ni pa\ ba ni\ ba: a'ata la ma ni pa\ kva ni pa\ ba ni pa\'o //

translated: And so forth.🔽The suffix āt is added to the root man,

original: byings a'ata\ mtha' can la ming du sgrub pa'i rkyen ma nipa\ dang kva nipa\ dang pa nipa rnams 'gyur te /

analyzed: su sngon ma'i ng'a la ma nipa\ pa\ rjes 'brel ai brjod don /

analyzed: su d'a man\ zhes 'grub pa la rnam dbye sbyor ba'i cho ga gong r'a dza na ltar bsgrubs pas /

translated: Thus, siṃha means a lion, which is a superlative harm-doer.🔽In the case of the verbal root tu, which means to go, a is changed to thu.🔽In the case of the verbal root tu, which means to go, the affix a is changed to thu.

translated: In the case of the verbal root tu, which means to go, the affix a is changed to thu.🔽Thus, tuve means to tremble and tuke means to throw with the hand.🔽Thus, vepatha means to tremble and kṣepatha means to throw.🔽In the case of the verbal root dvi, which means to go, the affix ta is changed to trimaka.

analyzed: be pa thu:....('dar ba/) kshe pa thu:....('phen pa/) sogs so /
translated: In the case of the verbal root dvi, which means to go, the affix ta is changed to trimaka.🔽Thus, dvitrika means to have gone beyond that.🔽In the case of the verbal root dvi, which means to go, the affix ta is changed to trimaka.🔽Thus, dvitrika means to have gone beyond that.

translated: The root śid means “to go” and bhid means “to split.”

original: byings sha\ yig rjes 'brel 'gro ba rnams dang bhida\ la sogs pa rnams las kyang rkyen aada\ @123b 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings sha\ yig rjes 'brel 'gro ba rnams dang bhida\ la sogs pa rnams las kyang rkyen aada\ @123b 'gyur te /
translated: The root śa, when followed by the suffix -i, becomes the affix -ad.🔽Śācī, “she cooks”; śrījā, “she purifies”; bhidā, “she splits.”

original: (a'apa\) ...pa ts'a/....('chad ma/) (a'apa\) ...gri dz'a/....(dag ma/) bhi d'a/...(a'apa\/🔽'jigs ma/) tstshi d'a ...(a'apa\/

translated: Cchid

original: dum bur byed ma/) sogs so //
analyzed: dum bur byed ma/) sogs so //
translated: The root cchid means “to cut.”🔽Cchidati, “he cuts”; cchidati, “he cuts.”🔽The root cchid, when followed by the suffix -i, becomes the affix -ad.🔽Cchidā, “she cuts.”

original: yang dza ra sogs la rkyen aada\ gi da\ yig med par aa nyid sbyor bar bshad de /
analyzed: yang dza ra sogs la rkyen aada\ gi da\ yig med par aa nyid sbyor bar bshad de /
translated: Again, it is explained that in the case of jara and so forth, the affix -ad is applied as a alone, without the -d- of the affix.

original: dza r'a ....(rgas pa/) sogs so /
analyzed: dza r'a ....(rgas pa/) sogs so /
translated: Jara, “old age.”

original: ` / gu re rha s'a ta\/
analyzed: ` / gu re rha s'a ta\/
translated: Gure

original: lci ba'i ha sa las so //
analyzed: lci ba'i ha sa las so //
translated: The root guru means “heavy.”

analyzed: byings au pa dh'a yi ge lci ba dang ldan pa'i ha sa'i mtha' can la'ang rkyen aang 'gyur te /
translated: The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,🔽and the sign is made feminine.🔽The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,

analyzed: a'i h'a/....(rtsed mo byed/) a'u h'a/....(rtog par byed/) a'eeksha ....('dod par byed/) sogs so / ` / pra tya y'ant'a ta\/

original: rkyen mtha' las so //
analyzed: rkyen mtha' las so //
translated: The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,🔽and the sign is made feminine.🔽The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,

analyzed: byings rkyen mtha' can las kyang rkyen aa 'gyur zhing rtags de'ang mo rtags su bya ste / tsi k'irsh'a/....(byed par 'dod/) pu tr'i y'a ....(bu 'dod ma/) sogs so /
translated: and the sign is made feminine.🔽The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,🔽and the sign is made feminine.🔽The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,

analyzed: ` / purba k'a le ktv'a /
translated: and the sign is made feminine.

analyzed: sngon gyi dus la ktva'o /
translated: The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,🔽and the sign is made feminine.🔽The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,🔽and the sign is made feminine.🔽The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,🔽and the sign is made feminine.

analyzed: sngon byung ba'i 'das pa yun ring song ba dang 'das nas yun ring ma song ba'i don la'ang rkyen ktv'a 'gyur te /

original: sn'a tv'a bhum kte/. ...(khrus byas nas zas bza'/) bhu ktv'a pra dza ti ....(bzos nas 'gro/) sogs so /
analyzed: sn'a tv'a bhum kte/. ...(khrus byas nas zas bza'/) bhu ktv'a pra dza ti ....(bzos nas 'gro/) sogs so /
translated: and the sign is made feminine.

original: ` / aa lam kha lvo: pra ti she dhe ktv'a /
analyzed: ` / aa lam kha lvo: pra ti she dhe ktv'a /
translated: The root pratya + the ending ya also changes to aṅ,🔽and the sign is made feminine.

original: aa la kha lu dag las dgag pa la ktv'a'o //
analyzed: aa la kha lu dag las dgag pa la ktv'a'o //
translated: From ala and kal, the negative is katva.

original: mi zad pa'i nang tshan aa lam dang kha lu dgag pa'i don can sngon ma'i byings las kyang rkyen ktv'a 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i nang tshan aa lam dang kha lu dgag pa'i don can sngon ma'i byings las kyang rkyen ktv'a 'gyur te /
translated: From the former roots ala and kal, which are members of the class of the indeclinables, the suffix katva is formed, which has the sense of negation.

original: aa lambh'u ktv'a/....(mi za'o/) kha l'u ktv'a ...(bdza //
analyzed: aa lambh'u ktv'a/....(mi za'o/) kha l'u ktv'a ...(bdza //
translated: Alambhu-katva, “he does not eat.” Kalau-katva, “he does not speak.”

original: smra 'phro chod/) sogs so /
analyzed: smra 'phro chod/) sogs so /
translated: And so on.

original: ` / ktv'a se ta\ ki dv'a /
analyzed: ` / ktv'a se ta\ ki dv'a /
translated: Katva-sesa-kida-dvau.

original: aita\ dang bcas pa'i ktv'a ka 'gro ba yang na'o //
analyzed: aita\ dang bcas pa'i ktv'a ka 'gro ba yang na'o //
translated: Katva, together with ita, is also a form of gam.

original: spyir rkyen ktv'a ka 'gro ba yin kyang aita\ dang bcas pa'i ktv'a ni ka\ 'gro ba'i ming can du yang na par bya ste /
analyzed: spyir rkyen ktv'a ka 'gro ba yin kyang aita\ dang bcas pa'i ktv'a ni ka\ 'gro ba'i ming can du yang na par bya ste /
translated: In general, katva is a form of gam, but katva, together with ita, is also a form of ka, which is called “gam.”

original: bi di tv'a/....(rig go'am shes so//) ....be di tv'a sogs so /
analyzed: bi di tv'a/....(rig go'am shes so//) ....be di tv'a sogs so /
translated: Vidatva, “he knows.” Vedatva, and so on.

original: ` / au di ta: ktv'a beta\/
analyzed: ` / au di ta: ktv'a beta\/
translated: Uditaḥ katva-vet/

original: auta\ 'gro ba las ktv'a ste aita yang na'o //
analyzed: auta\ 'gro ba las ktv'a ste aita yang na'o //
translated: Ut, from gam, is katva, and ita is also gam.

original: byings auta\ rjes 'brel 'gro ba las kyang rkyen ktv'a 'gyur zhing aita\ a'a ga ma ster ba 'dam ka can du bya ste /
analyzed: byings auta\ rjes 'brel 'gro ba las kyang rkyen ktv'a 'gyur zhing aita\ a'a ga ma ster ba 'dam ka can du bya ste /
translated: From the root ut, which is related to gam, the suffix katva is formed, and ita is also gam. It is given as an alternative.

original: ai shu 'dod pa la /
analyzed: ai shu 'dod pa la /
translated: Ishukam, “he desires.”

original: ai shi tv'a /🔽aisht'a/....('dod pa nyid/) ba su nges par gnas pa la /
analyzed: ai shi tv'a / aisht'a/....('dod pa nyid/) ba su nges par gnas pa la /
translated: iṣṭa🔽uṣṭa

original: au shi tv'a /
analyzed: au shi tv'a /
translated: uṣṭa🔽samāsak

original: aushtv'a nges par gnas /🔽sogs so / ` / sa m'a se kyapa\/🔽bsdu ba la kyapa\'o //
analyzed: aushtv'a nges par gnas / sogs so / ` / sa m'a se kyapa\/ bsdu ba la kyapa\'o //
translated: samāsaka

original: byings las tshig sdud dang 'brel ba'i byed pa'i don la'ang rkyen kyapa\ 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings las tshig sdud dang 'brel ba'i byed pa'i don la'ang rkyen kyapa\ 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of a verbal root, the affix kta is also used for the meaning of an agent in connection with a compound.🔽samāśritya karoti🔽praṇamya gacchati

original: sam bhri tye ka ro ti/....(kun nas 'phel bar byed/) pra na mya gatstsha ti ....(/ phyag btsal nas 'gro bar byed/) sogs so /
analyzed: sam bhri tye ka ro ti/....(kun nas 'phel bar byed/) pra na mya gatstsha ti ....(/ phyag btsal nas 'gro bar byed/) sogs so /

original: ` / yang kha cig tu na nya\ sbyor ba la'ang rkyen ktv'a sbyor bar bshad de /🔽aa dzi tv'a /
analyzed: ` / yang kha cig tu na nya\ sbyor ba la'ang rkyen ktv'a sbyor bar bshad de / aa dzi tv'a /
translated: In some cases, the affix kta is explained as being used for the meaning of an agent in the present tense.🔽ajitva🔽akṛtvā

original: aa kri tv'a /
analyzed: aa kri tv'a /
translated: adattvā

original: aa dattv'a sogs te /
analyzed: aa dattv'a sogs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: aa dzi tv'a sh'a tra b'a rsa rb'an kri tv'a bi ma lam ya sha:/🔽aa dattv'a mitta marthi bhya:ka tham dz'i banti bh'u bhri ta:/
analyzed: aa dzi tv'a sh'a tra b'a rsa rb'an kri tv'a bi ma lam ya sha:/ aa dattv'a mitta marthi bhya:ka tham dz'i banti bh'u bhri ta:/
translated: ajitvā śātravāṃ vīraṃ kṛtvā vimalaṃ yaśaḥ,🔽adattvā mittamārthibhyo katham jīvanti bhūbhṛtaḥ.

original: dgra rnams kun las rgyal bar ma 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dgra rnams kun las rgyal bar ma 'gyur bas /
translated: Since one will not be victorious over all enemies,

original: dri ma med pa'i grags ldan mi byed cing //🔽don kun rig phyir sbyin @124a * //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i grags ldan mi byed cing // don kun rig phyir sbyin @124a * //
translated: One does not become a renowned stainless one.

original: pa mi gtong na //
analyzed: pa mi gtong na //
translated: Because one knows all meanings, one does not give gifts.

original: sa 'dzin 'tsho ba'i gtam yang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa 'dzin 'tsho ba'i gtam yang med par 'gyur //
translated: Even the story of livelihood on the earth will be lost.

original: zhes so // yang rkyen kyapa\ pha rol las byings sngon ma de thung du yin pa'i bar rkyen nyi la yon tan byed par bshad de /
analyzed: zhes so // yang rkyen kyapa\ pha rol las byings sngon ma de thung du yin pa'i bar rkyen nyi la yon tan byed par bshad de /
translated: Also, it is explained that the suffix kyap makes the quality of the preceding root short,

original: pa ri na ...(nyi kyap\) me yyo bhu kte ....(yongs su 'dud nas zas za/) sogs se //
analyzed: pa ri na ...(nyi kyap\) me yyo bhu kte ....(yongs su 'dud nas zas za/) sogs se //
translated: as in parin-kyap, “to bow down,” and yoyo-bhu-kate, “to eat food after bowing down.”

original: yang dus dang 'brel pa la yang rkyen kyapa\ 'jug pa mthong ste /
analyzed: yang dus dang 'brel pa la yang rkyen kyapa\ 'jug pa mthong ste /
translated: Also, the suffix kyap is seen to be used in connection with time,🔽as in netri-sammilya-hasati, “to laugh with eyes tightly closed,”

original: (mig rab tu btsums nas dgod/) ....ne tre sam m'i lya ha sa ti/...(mi la\ kyapa\) mu kham by'a d'a ...(d'a) ya ...(kyapa\) sve pi ti ....(kha gdangs nas nyal/) sogs so /
analyzed: (mig rab tu btsums nas dgod/) ....ne tre sam m'i lya ha sa ti/...(mi la\ kyapa\) mu kham by'a d'a ...(d'a) ya ...(kyapa\) sve pi ti ....(kha gdangs nas nyal/) sogs so /
translated: mukha-vyada-ya, “to sleep with mouth open,” and so on.

original: ` / poo na: pu n+ye na ma pa dam dvi shtsa /
analyzed: ` / poo na: pu n+ye na ma pa dam dvi shtsa /
translated: Pounaḥ punyenam apadam dviśca.

original: yang yang la nama\ ste tshig gnyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang yang la nama\ ste tshig gnyis kyang ngo //
translated: Also, again and again, and the word twice.

original: byings las bzang ngan sogs dbye ba ma yin pa'i mnyam pa'i don dang yang yang bskyar ba'i don la rkyen nama\ 'gyur zhing byings rkyen dang bcas pa de'ang gnyis su brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byings las bzang ngan sogs dbye ba ma yin pa'i mnyam pa'i don dang yang yang bskyar ba'i don la rkyen nama\ 'gyur zhing byings rkyen dang bcas pa de'ang gnyis su brjod par bya ste /
translated: The root together with the affix is also to be expressed in two ways.🔽pāyampāyamasya

original: p'a yam b'a yam gatstsha ti/....(btungs shing btungs nas 'gro/) bho dzam bho dzam bra dza ti ....(zos shing zos nas 'gro/) sogs so /
analyzed: p'a yam b'a yam gatstsha ti/....(btungs shing btungs nas 'gro/) bho dzam bho dzam bra dza ti ....(zos shing zos nas 'gro/) sogs so /
translated: bhojambhojambhajasya

analyzed: ` / ka tha m'a di shu sva rthe na ma\ kri nya: ka tham la sogs pa rnams la kri nya las rang don la nama\'o//
translated: kaṭhamatādiśu svārthe na kṛtyāḥ

original: ka thi la sogs pa nye ba'i tshig tu yod pa la byings kri nya las rang gi don la rkyen nama\ 'jug ste /
analyzed: ka thi la sogs pa nye ba'i tshig tu yod pa la byings kri nya las rang gi don la rkyen nama\ 'jug ste /
translated: kaṭhamatādiṣu kṛtyāt svārthe na vartante|🔽kaṭhaṃkaraṃ

original: ka tham k'a ram/....(gang ltar byed/) ai rtham k'a ram ....('di ltar byed/) sogs so//🔽` bhu bo bha be kyapa\/
analyzed: ka tham k'a ram/....(gang ltar byed/) ai rtham k'a ram ....('di ltar byed/) sogs so// ` bhu bo bha be kyapa\/
translated: īrthakaraṃ🔽bhuvo bhave kvip

original: bh'u las dngos po la kyapa\'o //
analyzed: bh'u las dngos po la kyapa\'o //
translated: bhuvo bhāve kvip|

original: byings bh'u las dngos po'i don kho na brjod pa la'ang rkyen kyapa\ 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings bh'u las dngos po'i don kho na brjod pa la'ang rkyen kyapa\ 'gyur te /
translated: The root bhu means only the object of a thing. The affix khya is also a substitute for the affix kvip.🔽Brahmabhu-yam-gataḥ🔽Lakṣarī-mut-ca

original: brahma bh'u yam ga ta:....(srog can du gyur pa'i 'gro ba/) ` lakshe r'i muta\ tsa /🔽laksha\ la a'i ste muta\ yang ngo //
analyzed: brahma bh'u yam ga ta:....(srog can du gyur pa'i 'gro ba/) ` lakshe r'i muta\ tsa / laksha\ la a'i ste muta\ yang ngo //
translated: Lakṣa-la-ī-mut-ca

original: byings laksha mtshan nyid la rkyen a'i 'gyur zhing rkyen de la muta\ a'a ga ma ster bar bya ste /
analyzed: byings laksha mtshan nyid la rkyen a'i 'gyur zhing rkyen de la muta\ a'a ga ma ster bar bya ste /
translated: The root lakṣa means characteristic. The affix ī is a substitute for the affix kvip. The affix mut gives the affix ā.🔽Lakṣmīḥ

original: lakshm'i:....(dpal lam phun sum tshogs pa'am bkra shis/) ` sty'a ya te: str'i tve da\ ta\/🔽stye las bud med nyid la da\ ta\'o //
analyzed: lakshm'i:....(dpal lam phun sum tshogs pa'am bkra shis/) ` sty'a ya te: str'i tve da\ ta\/ stye las bud med nyid la da\ ta\'o //
translated: Satya-āyate satrī-tva-de-taḥ🔽From satya, the affix tva is added to the feminine.

original: byings styee nya sgra dang mnyam par 'dres pa las bud med nyid brjod pa'i don la rkyen da\ ta\ 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings styee nya sgra dang mnyam par 'dres pa las bud med nyid brjod pa'i don la rkyen da\ ta\ 'gyur te /
translated: From the root satya, the affix tva is added to the feminine.

original: shtyee la da\ ta\/
analyzed: shtyee la da\ ta\/
translated: Śatya-āyate

original: sha sa ta ta /
analyzed: sha sa ta ta /
translated: Śa-sat-ta

original: da\ 'gro ba la ti phyis /
analyzed: da\ 'gro ba la ti phyis /
translated: Ta means going.

original: ta\ 'gro ba sogs kyi mo rkyen a'ipa\ sbyar bas /
analyzed: ta\ 'gro ba sogs kyi mo rkyen a'ipa\ sbyar bas /
translated: Ta is a feminine affix for going and so on.

original: str'i/....(/ sgra ldan nam bde bar 'tsho ba ste bud med//) ` / barn'atk'a ra: yi ge las k'a ra'o //
analyzed: str'i/....(/ sgra ldan nam bde bar 'tsho ba ste bud med//) ` / barn'atk'a ra: yi ge las k'a ra'o //
translated: The suffix kara is added to the end of each letter.

original: yi ge so so'i mtha' las de dang de'i yi ge zhes rang bzhin brjod pa'i don la rkyen k'a ra 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge so so'i mtha' las de dang de'i yi ge zhes rang bzhin brjod pa'i don la rkyen k'a ra 'gyur te /
translated: The suffix kara is added to the end of each letter, and it means that letter in the sense of expressing its nature.

original: aa k'a ra:....(aa yig/) ka k'a ra:....(ka yig/) tsa k'a ra:....(tsa yig/) ta k'a ra:....(ta yig/) ta k'a ra:....(ta yig/) pa k'a ra:....(pa yig/) sogs so /
analyzed: aa k'a ra:....(aa yig/) ka k'a ra:....(ka yig/) tsa k'a ra:....(tsa yig/) ta k'a ra:....(ta yig/) ta k'a ra:....(ta yig/) pa k'a ra:....(pa yig/) sogs so /
translated: For example, akara means the letter a, kakara means the letter ka, cakara means the letter ca, takara means the letter ta, takara means the letter ta, pakara means the letter pa, and so on.

original: ` @124b r'a di le b'a/ ra las ai pha yang na'o //
analyzed: ` @124b r'a di le b'a/ ra las ai pha yang na'o //
translated: The suffix ana is added to the end of ra.

original: ra yig las de'i rang bzhin brjod ba'i don la ai pha yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: ra yig las de'i rang bzhin brjod ba'i don la ai pha yang na 'gyur te /
translated: The suffix ana is added to the end of the letter ra, and it means that nature in the sense of expressing its nature.🔽 For example, repha means the letter ra, rakara means the letter ra, and so on.

original: re pha:....(ra yig/) ....ra k'a ra: ` lo k'atstshe sha sya siddha: lhag ma 'jig rten las grub pa'o //
analyzed: re pha:....(ra yig/) ....ra k'a ra: ` lo k'atstshe sha sya siddha: lhag ma 'jig rten las grub pa'o //
translated: The rest is established by the world.

original: sngon du bshad pa ltar brda sbrod ba'i tshul gyi cho ga sogs nye bar mkho ba rnams bshad zin gyi /
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa ltar brda sbrod ba'i tshul gyi cho ga sogs nye bar mkho ba rnams bshad zin gyi /
translated: As explained before, the necessary rituals such as the method of giving signals have been explained.

original: 'dir ma bshad pa'i lhag ma 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la grags shing grub ba rnams kyang de dag tu shes par bya'o//
analyzed: 'dir ma bshad pa'i lhag ma 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la grags shing grub ba rnams kyang de dag tu shes par bya'o//
translated: The rest of the remaining unmentioned terms should be understood from the treatises and from worldly usage.🔽

original: ` ai ti sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'a tkri d'a da ya: bra kri ya sa m'a bt'a:/
analyzed: ` ai ti sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'a tkri d'a da ya: bra kri ya sa m'a bt'a:/
translated: The rest of the particles which are not explained here, but are known and established in the world and in the treatises, should be understood from those (sources).

original: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las kri ta\ la sogs pa'i rab tu bya ba rnams rdzogs so//🔽` // sva r'u p'anto& nu bh'u ty'a di: shabdo& bh'a dya tra s'artha ka: / sa maska r'i shu bh'am tsa kre pra kri y'am tsa tu ro tsi t'am //
analyzed: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las kri ta\ la sogs pa'i rab tu bya ba rnams rdzogs so// ` // sva r'u p'anto& nu bh'u ty'a di: shabdo& bh'a dya tra s'artha ka: / sa maska r'i shu bh'am tsa kre pra kri y'am tsa tu ro tsi t'am //
translated: iti svarasvatīvyākaraṇasyāṭakṛtādayaḥ prakṛtisamāptāḥ.🔽svāropāntodbhūtayoḥ śabdo bhadyatra sā(r)thaḥ,

original: thog mtha' rjes 'byor rang bzhin bzang po yis //
analyzed: thog mtha' rjes 'byor rang bzhin bzang po yis //
translated: samaskṛte śubhraṃ cakre prakṛtyā caturocitāṃ.

original: 'dir ni don bcas sgra la zhugs byas te //
analyzed: 'dir ni don bcas sgra la zhugs byas te //
translated: Here, having entered into the meaningful sound,

original: mtshungs par sbyod ldan dge bar byed pa yis //
analyzed: mtshungs par sbyod ldan dge bar byed pa yis //
translated: with the one who is endowed with the same application, the one who is virtuous,

original: rab tu bya ba gsal ldan bshad zin to //
analyzed: rab tu bya ba gsal ldan bshad zin to //
translated: the one who is endowed with the clear activity, has explained.

original: aa ba t'a dvo ha ya gr'i ba: ka ma l'a ka ra a'i shva ra: //
analyzed: aa ba t'a dvo ha ya gr'i ba: ka ma l'a ka ra a'i shva ra: //
translated: avatādadvohayagrīvaḥ kamalākaranāśvaraḥ.

original: su r'a su ra na r'a k'a ra ma dhu b'a p'i ta pam ga dza: //
analyzed: su r'a su ra na r'a k'a ra ma dhu b'a p'i ta pam ga dza: //
translated: The elephant of your body, O Horse-necked One, is protected by the goddess of speech.

original: khyod la srung bar mdzod cig rta mgrin kye //
analyzed: khyod la srung bar mdzod cig rta mgrin kye //
translated: Protect him, O Horse-necked One,

original: dbang gi mnga' sgyur phyag na padma yis //
analyzed: dbang gi mnga' sgyur phyag na padma yis //
translated: the lotus-handed one who rules over the powerful,

original: lha dang lha min mi la phan par ni //
analyzed: lha dang lha min mi la phan par ni //
translated: who is beneficial to gods, demigods, and humans,

original: sbrang rtsi 'thung bas chu skyes bzhin du skyongs //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi 'thung bas chu skyes bzhin du skyongs //
translated: like a bee protects a lotus.

original: de ltar ngag gi dbang phyug 'phags ma dbyangs can mas gnas lnga rig pa'i slob dpon chen bo aa nu bh'u ti sva ru b'a tsar++ya ste rjes su 'byor ba rang bzhin bzang po la dngos su stsal ba'i brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen bo dbyangs can by'a
analyzed: de ltar ngag gi dbang phyug 'phags ma dbyangs can mas gnas lnga rig pa'i slob dpon chen bo aa nu bh'u ti sva ru b'a tsar++ya ste rjes su 'byor ba rang bzhin bzang po la dngos su stsal ba'i brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen bo dbyangs can by'a
translated: Thus, the noble goddess Sarasvatī, the powerful one of speech, directly bestowed upon the great master of the five sciences, Anubhūtisvarūpa, the great treatise on grammar known as the Sarasvatavyākaraṇa,

original: ka ra na zhes grags pa'i gzhung /
analyzed: ka ra na zhes grags pa'i gzhung /
translated: the text of which is renowned as the Sarasvatavyākaraṇa.

original: slob dpon chen po de nyid kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa rab tu bya ba gsal ldan zhes pa dang bcas pa 'di yang /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po de nyid kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa rab tu bya ba gsal ldan zhes pa dang bcas pa 'di yang /
translated: This text, along with the commentary composed by the great master himself called the Prabhāvatī,

original: lha dang bcas ba'i 'gro pa yongs kyi ma 'dris pa'i mdza' bshes chen po 'phags pa phyag na padma nyid gdul bya'i snang ngor gsum ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur bzhengs pa don gyi slad du mtshan nas smos te /
analyzed: lha dang bcas ba'i 'gro pa yongs kyi ma 'dris pa'i mdza' bshes chen po 'phags pa phyag na padma nyid gdul bya'i snang ngor gsum ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur bzhengs pa don gyi slad du mtshan nas smos te /
translated: The great friend of all beings, including the gods, the noble Avalokiteśvara, appears in the perception of those to be tamed in the form of a vajra holder with the three sets of vows.🔽The lord of the victors, the great omniscient one, Ngawang Losang Gyatso Jikmé Gocha Tupten Langtso, said that there is a good translation of this text by Lhatong Lotsāwa that is about half a verse.

original: rgyal ba'i dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa chen po ngag dbang blo bzang rgya mtsho 'jigs med go cha thub bstan lang tsho'i sdes gzhung 'di la lha mthong lo ts'a ba'i phyed 'gyur tsam gyi legs po zhig yod tshod du 'dug pa deng sang dpe rgyun dkon zhing🔽phyis su bsgyur @125a * //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa chen po ngag dbang blo bzang rgya mtsho 'jigs med go cha thub bstan lang tsho'i sdes gzhung 'di la lha mthong lo ts'a ba'i phyed 'gyur tsam gyi legs po zhig yod tshod du 'dug pa deng sang dpe rgyun dkon zhing phyis su bsgyur @125a * //
translated: These days, it is rare to find a copy of it.

original: ba dang / yig sna kha shas 'dug kyang gzhung don go dka' ba dang slob dpon aa nus mdzad pa'i 'grel pa'i dgongs don dang ma 'brel ba sogs 'ga' re 'dug pas /
analyzed: ba dang / yig sna kha shas 'dug kyang gzhung don go dka' ba dang slob dpon aa nus mdzad pa'i 'grel pa'i dgongs don dang ma 'brel ba sogs 'ga' re 'dug pas /
translated: There are some later translations and a few texts, but the meaning of the text is difficult to understand and it is not connected with the meaning of the commentary composed by Ācārya Anu and so on.

original: khyod kyis pandi ta mched kyi gsung rgyun ltar 'di bzhin sgyur cig ces bka'i gnang ba thob par brten /
analyzed: khyod kyis pandi ta mched kyi gsung rgyun ltar 'di bzhin sgyur cig ces bka'i gnang ba thob par brten /
translated: I have received the order to translate this text according to the oral tradition of the brothers Panditas.🔽By the incomparable kindness of this excellent guide, the great scholar Balaprabha, born in the western land of Kuruksetra in India, of the Brahmin caste, and the brothers Panditas Gokulanathamisra,

original: rnam 'dren dam pa 'di nyid kyi gzhal du med pa'i bka' drin las 'phags yul nub phyogs ku ru kshe tra bram ze'i rigs su 'khrungs pa gnas lnga rig pa'i ma h'a pandi ta ba la bha dra dang / pandi ta go k'u la n'a tha mi shra mched kyi drung du gzhung 'grel 'di sogs brda sprod pa'i rang lugs la sbyangs pas cung zad tsam shes pa bka' 'bangs kyi tha chung gtsang stod 'dar gyi nor 'dzin yangs par se'i rigs las skyes pa ngag dbang phun🔽tshogs lhun grub bam /
analyzed: rnam 'dren dam pa 'di nyid kyi gzhal du med pa'i bka' drin las 'phags yul nub phyogs ku ru kshe tra bram ze'i rigs su 'khrungs pa gnas lnga rig pa'i ma h'a pandi ta ba la bha dra dang / pandi ta go k'u la n'a tha mi shra mched kyi drung du gzhung 'grel 'di sogs brda sprod pa'i rang lugs la sbyangs pas cung zad tsam shes pa bka' 'bangs kyi tha chung gtsang stod 'dar gyi nor 'dzin yangs par se'i rigs las skyes pa ngag dbang phun tshogs lhun grub bam /
translated: I, the youngest of the king's subjects, born in the vast land of Dar in upper Tsang, of the Se clan, named Ngawang Phuntshog Lhundrub,

original: tshe dbang rab brtan rdo rjer 'bod pa'i rmongs brtul snyom las pas /
analyzed: tshe dbang rab brtan rdo rjer 'bod pa'i rmongs brtul snyom las pas /
translated: also called Tshewang Rabten Dorje, a foolish and lazy monk,🔽having studied this commentary and other texts in the grammar tradition, know just a little bit.

original: me mkha' rgya mtsho la 'das lo drug cu skor bcu dang nyag sum cu rtsa brgyad bsre ba sna tshogs dbyig ces shing sbrul hor zla gsum pa'i dmar phyogs kyi dga' ba dang po'i gza' tshes dge bar mgo btsugs lo de'i hor zla dgu pa'i tshes bco lnga
analyzed: me mkha' rgya mtsho la 'das lo drug cu skor bcu dang nyag sum cu rtsa brgyad bsre ba sna tshogs dbyig ces shing sbrul hor zla gsum pa'i dmar phyogs kyi dga' ba dang po'i gza' tshes dge bar mgo btsugs lo de'i hor zla dgu pa'i tshes bco lnga
translated: The calculations were made by the astrologer Meka Gyatso, who added up the years, months and days of the past sixty-one years and thirty-eight years, and called it “The Various Jewels”. The work was begun on the first day of the first month of the waxing moon of the third month of the wood-snake year (1653), on an auspicious day of the week.

original: dkar po nam gru'i 'grub sbyor gyi dus dge bar /
analyzed: dkar po nam gru'i 'grub sbyor gyi dus dge bar /
translated: It was completed on the fifteenth day of the ninth month of that year, on a day of the week when the moon was in the constellation of Kar-po-nam-tru.

original: sde bzhi'i sgo 'phar cig car du phye ba'i phun tshogs lugs brgya'i 'dun sa chen po pho brang po ta lar bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: sde bzhi'i sgo 'phar cig car du phye ba'i phun tshogs lugs brgya'i 'dun sa chen po pho brang po ta lar bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: It was translated and edited at the great palace of Potala, the place where a hundred excellent traditions were simultaneously opened up like doors, on a day of the week when the moon was in the constellation of Kar-po-nam-tru.

original: tshul 'dir sgo gsum 'bad sogs rnam dkar 'bras //
analyzed: tshul 'dir sgo gsum 'bad sogs rnam dkar 'bras //
translated: All the good results of the efforts of my three doors in this work

original: ji snyed mchis kun yongs su smin pa'i mthus //
analyzed: ji snyed mchis kun yongs su smin pa'i mthus //
translated: have been completely ripened by the power of my merit

original: rigs kun khyab bdag don gyi thams cad mkhyen //
analyzed: rigs kun khyab bdag don gyi thams cad mkhyen //
translated: and I have become the all-knowing lord of all the families.

original: srid mtha'i bar du zhabs pad brtan pa dang // sna mang brda sprod ring lugs chu gter che //
analyzed: srid mtha'i bar du zhabs pad brtan pa dang // sna mang brda sprod ring lugs chu gter che //
translated: May his lotus feet remain firm until the end of existence and may the great ocean of the tradition of the many languages

original: bsrubs pa'i snying po legs bshad nyin byed 'dis //
analyzed: bsrubs pa'i snying po legs bshad nyin byed 'dis //
translated: May this sun of eloquent advice, the essence of the churning,

original: lnga rig bstan pa'i pad tshal cher rgyas shing //
analyzed: lnga rig bstan pa'i pad tshal cher rgyas shing //
translated: cause the lotus grove of the teachings of the five sciences to blossom🔽and clear away the darkness of the mind’s confusion.

original: rab rmongs blo yi mun pa sel bar shog / bdag sogs deng nas skye dang tshe rabs su ;
analyzed: rab rmongs blo yi mun pa sel bar shog / bdag sogs deng nas skye dang tshe rabs su ;
translated: From now on, throughout all my lives,

original: / mchog gsum ngo bo rdo rje slob dpon gyis //
analyzed: / mchog gsum ngo bo rdo rje slob dpon gyis //
translated: may I be accepted by the vajra master, the embodiment of the Three Jewels,

original: rjes bzung gsang chen zab mo'i lam zhugs te //
analyzed: rjes bzung gsang chen zab mo'i lam zhugs te //
translated: enter the path of the profound Great Secret,

original: zung 'jug bde ba chen po'i sa thob shog /
analyzed: zung 'jug bde ba chen po'i sa thob shog /
translated: and attain the stage of great bliss, the state of union.
